title: [RESOLVED] Troubleshooting connection issues - 4/03/2015
body:
Hi summoners,

We're aware of an ongoinig issue that is causing some players to have problems connecting to the League of Legends servers.  I'll be posting updates to this thread as we have them.

**Update - 1105 AEDT**:  Loss Prevention has been enabled and Ranked queues disabled while we troubleshoot further.

**Update - 1155 AEDT**: We've identified the cause of the issue, and are making changes at the moment to fix it.  We'll keep Loss Prevention on until we are confident that it is fully resolved.

**Update - 1305 AEDT**: Connectivity has been restored to normal.  Loss prevention has been turned off again and Ranked has been re-enabled.

We're really sorry for the bumpy morning.  The League platform has quite a few moving parts that can break from time to time.   We're looking over what happened so that we can level up, and make sure this part of our systems won't fail like this in the future.


Thanks
Mindstar

May i ask what will happen in regards to all of the losses that have begun today due to DC issues?

Unfortunately not.  Loss prevention isn't retroactive, and can only catch games in progress when it is turned on (and games that start while it is on).
What happens to the people that got the 20 min queue wait times because of this problem?

Players who got 20 minute queues as a result of this were likely on track to get them anyway.  The leaver buster system does not put that level of restriction in place without a history of leaving games.

It is set up this way so players aren't punished inadvertently during server issues.
